title: noormcs5
author: noormcs5
content: Bitcoin has broken the all time high of 2017 and now it is around 19,000$. The worst part is that even on these level, we are not seeing any pumps and look like price may fall all the way to 10,000$ or even lower.Once bitcoin was at 69,000$, who would have thought that bitcoin will go so low so fast ?  Now what do think, where we are in terms of bitcoin cycle. I think we are already in th bear market since summer of last year and maybe the bottom/ end of bear market is near ?

comments.author: bayudndy
comments.body: I don't care too much about technical analysis, but to be honest about the support levels I've heard, prices below current value don't freak me out. Although there are many disappointments, it is my own making for myself. I think I missed the opportunity to sell them for a better profit, but anyway, I am very grateful for what BTC as well as the crypto market brought to me.And now that the support levels are gradually being broken, I think it is also necessary to rebuild the strategy to buy them back and hold them for the next 2-3 years.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on June 18, 2022, 12:14:00 PMBitcoin has broken the all time high of 2017 and now it is around 19,000$. The worst part is that even on these level, we are not seeing any pumps and look like price may fall all the way to 10,000$ or even lower.Once bitcoin was at 69,000$, who would have thought that bitcoin will go so low so fast ?  Now what do think, where we are in terms of bitcoin cycle. I think we are already in th bear market since summer of last year and maybe the bottom/ end of bear market is near ?Bitcoin didn't disappoint me at all despite the current price drop, because I perceive bitcoin not just as a speculative instrument, but as an instrument of freedom and independence from the traditional banking system. In this regard, from the moment of its appearance and existence to the present day, from the moment I learned about bitcoin, I had no reason to doubt the capabilities of bitcoin and be disappointed. Any price is a temporary phenomenon and you should not dwell on it. Look at the cost counter less often and you will have less worries.The bear market has been going on since the end of last year, winter, and not from the end of summer, as you said. I will assume that the bear market is only in the initial stages and will last for a relatively long time, therefore, be patient.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Disappointment can be felt by people who invested in bitcoin when it was expensive, and now they are losing. But for other people, this is just another natural fall in bitcoin, which occurs regularly, after which bitcoin, despite everything, steadily steps up. As I often hear experienced investors say, "when it gets scary to sell and everyone panics, maybe this is the best time to start investing." Can these people be disappointed?To say that the bottom has finally arrived is, in my opinion, a sound for complacency. Is there anyone who can definitively predict something?If you have prepared yourself for the fact that you may one day lose your money by following the rule of investing with Bitcoin, then there should be no disappointment because, with due patience, you should remain in the black.

comments.author: ForMeritt
comments.body: I don't really care about the red market, especially Bitcoin, and I don't think I'm too depressed about the current state of Bitcoin because I believe hearing these two words UP and DOWN can mean that the movement of the Cryptocurrency market is like this, there are ups and downs, which makes me very sure the first Bitcoin Bitcoin is the only coin that is the most perfect among other coins.So as long as I stick to Bitcoin it never disappoints, I made a lot of profit in the days before the market took a turn for the worse like it is today.

comments.author: Awwal08
comments.body: Bitcoin has never disappointed me; yet, people tend to focus on the great aspects of bitcoin while overlooking the bad aspects. We are all ecstatic when the price of bitcoin rises to $69000, and we expect it to rise to $100k in the future. If you're always thinking about moving forward, consider going backwards as well.Cryptocurrency is all about the ability to rise and fall at any time.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: And this latest dip right now is a little more interesting because it has finally invalidated the argument that regardless of when you purchased your Bitcoin or how much you bought it, you only need to HODL for at least 4 years and you are guaranteed of profit. It has now been effectively broken. I wasn't really expecting the price to go down this low, but I'm not disappointed. I guess I'm a little sad, though. But of course everybody knows Bitcoin will always come out of every bear season not only alive but stronger.

Bitcoin is major reason behind the countless number of crash in the Crypto markets. Bitcoin is currently at $20k and some Investors are losing money while others are gaining massive Profits. Crypto as they say, it's not for the weak, investors need to build patience and be able to face their lose. Although is not easy to see your portfolio which was $5k few weeks ago, all you hoping to see like 3x of your capital. You suddenly see $1k or even less. So the best thing is to hold Bitcoin at its ATL price and sell at it's ATH price.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Disappointed? Not in my vocabulary .I mean, why you will be disappointed with Bitcoin? Is it because it went down from as high as $69,000 to now around $19,000 in just a matter of months? Is it because you bought at it's peak, or is it because you are at a loss now? What disappoints me more is the people who are saying negative things about Bitcoin just because they are at a loss right now. I'm more disappointed with the people who are saying "Bitcoin is over" or "Bitcoin is dead" etc. To those pessimists out there, just continue to tell negative things to Bitcoin, since you can only say whenever Bitcoin is at its lowest. History repeats itself and after the dark days, a bright light will come and all the people (including me) who are constantly accumulating Bitcoin when it is down are the ones who will gain the most profit .

comments.author: TheGhostMan
comments.body: Not at all, Bitcoin has not let me down… Some people feel insecure due to the current crisis in the cryptocurrency market. And their situations are understandable since all this has led to various shocks, such as unemployment, project failure and of course for those people who bought at a high point, it could be said that they "lost part of the investment", all this causes fear … But as the saying goes “good face to bad weather” look at it as an opportunity, invest buy now that it is in a bearish state since at some point we are going to take off, this has already happened a couple of times maybe and it always starts to fall little by little, but when we go up we do it with force.

comments.author: PrivacyG
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on June 18, 2022, 12:14:00 PMOnce bitcoin was at 69,000$, who would have thought that bitcoin will go so low so fast ?This.  Stop right there.  How fast did Bitcoin go from $20,000 to $60,000?  Pretty fast, right?  If so, why do you expect it to drop slower than that?You only need Bitcoin's historical chart and five minutes of analysis to understand this is how Bitcoin went every halving cycle.I say we are in the middle of the bear market.  I think this one will take a bit longer due to economical and geopolitical issues mixed with what could become the next declared public health issue by the next week.  Remember we are in the middle of hyperinflation.  Bitcoin might be extremely volatile right now.-Regards,PrivacyG

comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on June 18, 2022, 12:14:00 PMOnce bitcoin was at 69,000$, who would have thought that bitcoin will go so low so fast ?Witnessing the price trend of Bitcoin in since 2014, I am not surprised that the price plummet from $69k to the current price of sub $20k.  It always happens within year after the bull market or 2 years after the halving.Quote from: noormcs5 on June 18, 2022, 12:14:00 PM  Now what do think, where we are in terms of bitcoin cycle. comments.author: Wexnident
comments.body: Not really no. I mean I experienced way worse in my early days, especially the dip when covid started which basically made me lose a LOT since I just exited the market rather dumbly in the middle of the drop-off. Managed to get some of it back. After that, I just decided to DCA my way into trading and stopped thinking about the market price at every single moment. I've moved my mindset from seeing dumps like this to something natural instead and I just let it fly by my head. Not that I ignore it, but rather even if I panic, nothing's gonna change how the market moves right now.

comments.author: Fortify
comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on June 18, 2022, 12:14:00 PMBitcoin has broken the all time high of 2017 and now it is around 19,000$. The worst part is that even on these level, we are not seeing any pumps and look like price may fall all the way to 10,000$ or even lower.Once bitcoin was at 69,000$, who would have thought that bitcoin will go so low so fast ?  Now what do think, where we are in terms of bitcoin cycle. I think we are already in th bear market since summer of last year and maybe the bottom/ end of bear market is near ?This is turning into a bit of a vicious cycle, where the more selling that takes place the more people lose trust in the longer term future of Bitcoin and decide to sell off even further. However it is going to shake out a lot of people who claimed to be wanting to hold it forever, when in actual fact they just hoped it would double or triple from their buy in point so they could sell it off and profit. Bitcoin never disappointed me, because it was always just a mechanism of payment and it was a bad idea to keep actual currency stored within it. A lot of people who could have been millionaires, but retained trust as it keeps on dropping, are going to have big regrets later on - but they were kinda driven by greed when they should have cashed out long ago.

comments.author: Argoo
comments.body: The price of bitcoin is now $19,023 and continues to fall. Accordingly, altcoins also fell in price. Ethereum is now less than one thousand dollars. Now, I think those who bought bitcoin at a much higher price than the current one are disappointed. Also, the hopes of those who believed that after the last ATH, bitcoin would no longer be able to fall in price below $20,000, as well as those who believed that in the first half of this year, bitcoin would definitely reach one hundred thousand dollars, did not materialize. It turns out that not everything is as rosy in the world of cryptocurrency as many thought. I think that the current price drop will make many think before buying bitcoin at a high price. This may negatively affect the rapid growth of the price of bitcoin in the future. Especially already at the stage when he will gain a decent price height.
